sen.j: 治部卿局（じぶきょうのつぼね、仁平2年（1152年）- 寛喜3年9月11日 (旧暦)（1231年10月8日））は、平安時代末期、鎌倉時代前期の女性。
sen.e: Otsubone Court Lady of Jibukyo (1152-October 8, 1231) was a woman from the end of the Heian period through until the first half of the Kamakura period.
Otsubone Court Lady of Jibukyo (1152 - October 8, 1231) was a woman from the late Heian and early Kamakura periods.

sen.j: 平知盛の妻。
sen.e: She was the wife of TAIRA no Tomonori.
She was the wife of TAIRA no Tomonori.

sen.j: 後高倉院（守貞親王）の乳母。
sen.e: She was a wet nurse of Gotakakura-in (Imperial Prince Morisada).
She was a wet nurse of Gotakakura-in (Imperial Prince Morisada).

sen.j: 子に平知章、平知忠、中納言局（高倉範茂室）。
sen.e: TAIRA no Tomoakira, TAIRA no Tomotada, and Chunagon no tsubone (wife of Norishige TAKAKURA) were her children.

sen.j: はじめ従二位平時子に仕えて南御方（みなみのおんかた）と呼ばれた。
sen.e: She originally served Junii (Junior Second Rank), TAIRA no Tokiko, and was called Minami no onkata.

sen.j: 治承3年（1179年）、守貞親王の乳母となって候名（さぶらいな）を「治部卿」とした。
sen.e: In 1179, she became a wet nurse of Imperial Prince Morisada, and made Saburai na (given name in the court) as`jibukyo' (Minister of the Ministry of Civil Administration).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: In 1179, she became a wet nurse for Imperial Prince Morisada, and choose "Jibukyo" as her saburai na (given name in the court).

sen.j: 後年は四条局（しじょうのつぼね）と呼ばれる。
sen.e: Later in her life, she was called Shijo no tsubone.

sen.j: 出自ははっきりしていないが、「御方」と敬称で呼ばれるのは大臣の娘である事から、治部卿局が時子の女房となった時期に内大臣の地位にあり、平清盛と縁の深い内大臣藤原忠雅が父親と考えられる。
sen.e: Her origin was not clear, but her father was deemed to be FUJIWARA no Tadamasa who was the Naidaijin (the Minister of the Interior) when Otsubone Court Lady of Jibukyo was a nyobo of Tokiko and who had deep ties with TAIRA no Kiyomori given that she was called the `onkata,' which meant she was a daughter of daijin (minister).

Her origin was not clear, but given the fact that she was called "onkata," which meant she was a daughter of a daijin (minister), her father was believed to be FUJIWARA no Tadamasa, who was the Naidaijin (the Minister of the Interior) when Otsubone Court Lady of Jibukyo was a nyobo of Tokiko, and who had close relations with TAIRA no Kiyomori.

sen.j: 仁安 (日本)2年（1167年）頃、平氏全盛期に同年齢の平知盛に見初められて妻となった。
sen.e: When the Taira clan was prosperous around 1167, TAIRA no Tomonori who was her age fell in love with and married her.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Around 1167, during a time when the Taira clan was prosperous, TAIRA no Tomonori fell in love with and married Otsubone Court Lady of Jibukyo, who was the same age as him.

sen.j: 嘉応元年（1169年）に18歳で長男平知章を生む。
sen.e: She gave birth to her eldest son, TAIRA no Tomoakira in 1169 when she was eighteen.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: She gave birth to their eldest son, TAIRA no Tomoakira, in 1169, when she was 18 years old.

sen.j: 舅の平清盛の指示によって治承3年（1179年）に生まれた高倉天皇の第二皇子守貞親王の乳母となった。
sen.e: She became the wet nurse of Imperial Prince Morisada who was born as the second prince of Emperor Takakura in 1179 by the order from her father in law, TAIRA no Kiyomori.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。

sen.j: 夫知盛と共に自邸で親王を養育した。
sen.e: She brought up the imperial prince at home with her husband, Tomonori.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: She and her husband, Tomonori, raised the Imperial Prince at their residence.

sen.j: その後治承・寿永の乱が起こり、戦乱の中で長男知章は一ノ谷の戦いで討ち死にした。
sen.e: Thereafter, Jisho-Juei Civil War took place, and her eldest son, Tomoakira was killed by the Battle of Ichinotani.
Thereafter, the Jisho-Juei Civil War took place, and her eldest son, Tomoakira, was killed in the Battle of Ichinotani.

sen.j: 寿永2年（1183年）7月、守貞親王を伴って平氏一門の都落ちに同行。
sen.e: In July, 1183, she followed the Taira clan exiling from the capital; the Imperial Prince Morisada was with her.
In July 1183, she was part of the exile of Imperial Prince Morisada and the Taira clan from the capital.

sen.j: 文治元年（1185年）4月、壇ノ浦の戦いで夫知盛は自害し、平氏一門は滅亡した。
sen.e: In April 1185, her husband, Tomonori killed himself in the Battle of Dan no ura, thus the Taira clan died out.

sen.j: 治部卿局は生き残って守貞親王や建礼門院ら一門の女性たちと共に都へ戻り、縁者である藤原隆房夫妻の四条大宮邸に身を寄せた。
sen.e: Otsubone Court Lady of Jibukyo went back to Kyoto with the Imperial Prince Morisada and women from the Taira clan including Kenreimonin, lived in the house of FUJIWARA no Takafusa, her relative, in Shijo-Omiya.

Otsubone Court Lady of Jibukyo went back to Kyoto with the Imperial Prince Morisada and the women of the Taira clan, including Kenreimonin, and lived in Shijo-Omiya at the residence of her relative, FUJIWARA no Takafusa.

sen.j: 守貞親王は上西門院統子内親王の養子となった事から、治部卿局は親王の乳母として上西門院に仕えた。
sen.e: The Imperial Prince Morisada was adopted by the Princess Josaimonin Muneko, and Otsubone Court Lady of Jibukyo served Josaimonin as a wet nurse of the imperial prince.

sen.e: She and the Imperial Prince Morisada learned from FUJIWARA no Takamichi, and became excellent players of biwa (Japanese flute).

sen.j: 建久7年（1196年）6月、都落ちの際に幼少であったため乳母に預けたまま生き別れになっていた次男平知忠が謀反を起こして梟首された。
sen.e: In July in 1196, her second son, TAIRA no Tomotada who had been left with his wet nurse ever since the exile of the Taira clan was beheaded for his rebellion.
